content.text:
# Rajpara State (Gohelwar)

Rajpara is a village and former non-salute Rajput princely state on Saurashtra peninsula in Gujarat, western India.
History
The petty princely state, in Gohelwar prant, was ruled by Sarvaiya Rajput Chieftains. In 1901 it comprised a single village, with a population of 552, yielding 2,150 Rupees state revenue (1903â€“4, nearly all from land), paying 274 Rupees tribute, to the Gaikwar Baroda State and Junagadh State.
See also
* Rajpara State (Halar)
